meanings.definition: Relating to the study of the upper atmosphere of the earth and of outer space.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used aeronomical tools to observe the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her aeronomical research focused on the layers of the atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The aeronomical equipment went haywire and started measuring clouds indoors.
meanings.sent4: His mind soared to aeronomical heights as he pondered the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The aeronomical data painted a vivid picture of the celestial bodies above.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the science of aeronomy.
meanings.sent1: The textbook explained the aeronomical principles in simple terms.
meanings.sent2: She attended an aeronomical conference to learn more about the field.
meanings.sent3: The aeronomical experiment unexpectedly created a mini lightning storm.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were as aeronomical as the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The aeronomical concepts opened up a whole new world of possibilities.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the composition, behavior, and effects of the earth's atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The aeronomical changes in the atmosphere were carefully monitored.
meanings.sent2: Scientists discussed the aeronomical impact of pollution on climate.
meanings.sent3: The aeronomical study of clouds led to some surprising discoveries.
meanings.sent4: Her aeronomical insights shed light on the complexities of weather patterns.
meanings.sent5: The aeronomical analysis revealed the delicate balance of gases in the air.
